item.title: Why FDN?
item.description:
Why FDN? Because Your Doctor Isn’t Looking for What’s Actually Wrong

After spending 24 years being told “everything’s normal” while I wasted away to 170 pounds at 6'5", I learned something critical: the medical system isn’t designed to find what’s actually wrong. It’s designed to manage disease.

The VA. Civilian clinics. Specialists. Endocrinologists. It didn’t matter where I went—the system itself is the problem, not just one hospital or doctor.

item.title: Do You Really Need to Test Food Sensitivities? (Or Can You Just Eliminate Foods?)
item.description:
You’re bloated after every meal. Your joints ache. Your skin breaks out. You have brain fog that won’t quit.

Someone tells you, “It’s probably a food sensitivity. Just cut out gluten, dairy, soy, eggs, nuts, and nightshades for 30 days and see how you feel.”

So you do it. You eliminate half your diet. You eat plain chicken, rice, and steamed broccoli for a month.

And… maybe you feel a little better? Or maybe not. Hard to tell. You’re also miserable, starving, and avoiding social situations because you can’t eat anything.

item.title: The Truth About Adrenal Supplements (What Works, What Doesn't)
item.description:
You’re exhausted all the time. You can’t wake up in the morning. You crash every afternoon. You’re wired at night despite being bone-tired.

Someone tells you about “adrenal support” supplements. You start Googling.

Suddenly, you’re overwhelmed:

  • Ashwagandha
  • Rhodiola
  • Holy basil
  • Licorice root
  • Adrenal cortex extract
  • Adrenal glandulars
  • Vitamin C
  • B vitamins
  • Phosphatidylserine

You buy a “complete adrenal support formula” for $60 a bottle. You take it religiously for a month.

item.title: Why 'Detox Teas' Don't Actually Detox Anything (And What Really Works)
item.description:
Article 2: “Why ‘Detox Teas’ Don’t Actually Detox Anything”

Scroll through Instagram for five minutes and you’ll see it:

A influencer with a flat stomach holding a cute jar of tea, promising it will “flush toxins,” “debloat you overnight,” and “reset your system.”

$40 later, you’re chugging this tea twice a day.

And you know what happens?

You spend a lot of time on the toilet.

You lose a few pounds (mostly water weight).

item.title: Your Thyroid Is Fine - Your TSH Is Normal
item.description:
Myth #5: “Your Thyroid Is Fine - Your TSH Is Normal”

You’re exhausted. You can’t lose weight. Your hair is falling out. You’re cold all the time. Your brain feels like mush.

You go to the doctor. They run a TSH test. It comes back “normal.”

“Your thyroid is fine,” they say. “Maybe try exercising more and eating less.”

The claim: TSH (Thyroid Stimulating Hormone) is the definitive test for thyroid function. If it’s in range, your thyroid is fine.

item.title: Just Take a Probiotic—It'll Fix Your Gut
item.description:
Myth #4: “Just Take a Probiotic—It’ll Fix Your Gut”

Walk into any pharmacy or health food store, and you’ll see hundreds of probiotic options.

The claim: Probiotics are a cure-all for gut issues. Take one daily and your gut will heal.

The reality: Most people are wasting money on probiotics that either don’t work or aren’t addressing the actual problem.

Why This Myth Is Harmful:

1. Not All Probiotics Are Created Equal

item.title: Everyone Should Follow [Insert Diet Here]
item.description:
Myth #3: “Everyone Should Follow [Insert Diet Here]”

Keto. Paleo. Vegan. Carnivore. Low-fat. High-carb. Intermittent fasting.

The claim: There’s ONE perfect diet that works for everyone.

The reality: There’s no one-size-fits-all diet. What works for your friend, your trainer, or the influencer you follow might be terrible for YOUR body.

Why This Myth Is Harmful:

1. It Ignores Bio-Individuality

Your genetics, metabolic type, gut microbiome, stress levels, activity level, and health history all affect how you respond to food.

item.title: You Just Need to Eat Less and Exercise More
item.description:
Myth #2: “You Just Need to Eat Less and Exercise More”

This is the most pervasive—and damaging—myth in health and fitness.

The claim: Weight loss (and health) is purely about calories in vs. calories out. If you’re not losing weight, you’re eating too much or not exercising enough.

The reality: Your body is not a simple math equation. Hormones, metabolism, stress, sleep, gut health, and inflammation all affect how your body processes food and stores fat.

item.title: Detox Teas and Cleanses Will Reset Your Body
item.description:
Myth #1: “Detox Teas and Cleanses Will Reset Your Body”

Walk into any health food store or scroll Instagram for 5 minutes, and you’ll see:

  • Detox teas promising to “flush toxins”
  • 3-day juice cleanses that “reset your system”
  • Colon cleanses that claim to remove “years of built-up waste”

The claim: Your body is full of toxins, and you need special products to detox.

The reality: Your body detoxes itself—every single day—through your liver, kidneys, lungs, skin, and gut. That’s literally their job.

item.title: Why Sleep Matters More Than You Think (And What Your Body Does While You're 'Doing Nothing')
item.description:
You know you should sleep more. Everyone says so.

But when you’re exhausted, wired at night, and have a to-do list a mile long, sleep feels like a luxury you can’t afford.

So you push through. You survive on 5-6 hours. You wear your sleep deprivation like a badge of honor.

“I’ll sleep when I’m dead,” you joke.

Here’s the problem: Your body doesn’t see sleep as optional. While you’re unconscious, your body is running critical processes that literally keep you alive and functioning.

item.title: Adrenal Fatigue Is Real (Even If Your Doctor Says It Isn't)
item.description:
You wake up exhausted despite sleeping 8 hours. You need multiple cups of coffee just to feel human by noon. You hit a wall around 2pm that makes you want to crawl under your desk. But then, right when you should be winding down for bed, you get a second wind—feeling wired, anxious, unable to shut your brain off.

You drag yourself to the doctor, certain something is wrong with your adrenal glands.

item.title: 5 Signs Your Cortisol Rhythm Is Broken
item.description:
You set an alarm for 6 AM with the best intentions. But when it goes off, you feel like you’ve been hit by a truck. Dragging yourself out of bed takes an act of will. Coffee is non-negotiable.

Then something strange happens around 10 PM. Just when you should be winding down, you get a second wind. Your brain starts racing. You’re suddenly productive—or at least, awake. By midnight, you’re still scrolling, still wired, wondering why sleep feels so far away.

item.title: 3 Hidden Stressors Sabotaging Your Energy
item.description:
You’ve tried everything: more sleep, cleaner diet, supplements. But you still wake up exhausted.

The problem? You’re addressing the obvious stressors while missing the hidden ones.

1. Blue Light After Dark

Your circadian rhythm depends on darkness signals. Even dim screens tell your brain it’s still daytime, suppressing melatonin for hours.

What to do: Install f.lux on your computer, use blue-blocking glasses after 8 PM, or switch devices to grayscale mode.
